Find the maximum value of
\[\frac{x - y}{x^4 + y^4 + 6}\]over all real numbers $x$ and $y.$
inference:
By AM-GM,
\[x^4 + y^4 \ge 2 \sqrt{x^4 y^4} = 2x^2 y^2.\]Then
\begin{align*}
x^4 + y^4 + 6 &\ge 2x^2 y^2 + 6 \\
&= 2(x^2 y^2 + 3) \\
&\ge 2 \cdot 2 \sqrt{x^2 y^2 \cdot 3} \\
&= 4 \sqrt{3} |xy|.
\end{align*}Hence,
\[\frac{x - y}{x^4 + y^4 + 6} \le \frac{x - y}{4 \sqrt{3} |xy|} = \frac{1}{4 \sqrt{3}} \cdot \frac{x - y}{|xy|}.\]If $xy > 0,$ then
\[\frac{x - y}{|xy|} = \frac{x}{xy} - \frac{y}{xy} = \frac{1}{y} - \frac{1}{x}.\]If $xy < 0,$ then
\[\frac{x - y}{|xy|} = -\frac{x}{xy} + \frac{y}{xy} = -\frac{1}{y} + \frac{1}{x}.\]In either case,
\[\left| \frac{x - y}{|xy|} \right| = \left| \frac{1}{y} - \frac{1}{x} \right| = \left| \frac{x - y}{xy} \right|.\]By AM-GM,
\[\frac{x + y}{2} \ge \sqrt{xy},\]so $xy \le \frac{(x + y)^2}{4}.$  Hence,
\[\left| \frac{x - y}{|xy|} \right| \ge \left| \frac{x - y}{(x + y)^2 / 4} \right| = 4 \left| \frac{x - y}{(x + y)^2} \right|.\]Then
\[\frac{x - y}{x^4 + y^4 + 6} \le \frac{1}{4 \sqrt{3}} \cdot 4 \left| \frac{x - y}{(x + y)^2} \right| = \frac{1}{\sqrt{3}} \left| \frac{x - y}{(x + y)^2} \right|.\]Let $t = \frac{x}{y}.$  Then
\[\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}} \left| \frac{x - y}{(x + y)^2} \right| = \frac{1}{\sqrt{3}} \left| \frac{t - 1}{(t + 1)^2} \right|.\]We can check that the function $\frac{t - 1}{(t + 1)^2}$ is increasing on $(-\infty,-1)$ and $(-1,\infty),$ so its maximum value occurs at either $t = -1$ or $t = 1.$  At $t = -1,$ the value is 0.  At $t = 1,$ the value is 0.  Hence, the maximum value is $\boxed{0}.$
ground_truth:
Clearly, the maximum occurs when $x$ is positive and $y$ is negative.  Let $z = -y,$ so $z$ is positive, and $y = -z.$  Then
\[\frac{x - y}{x^4 + y^4 + 6} = \frac{x + z}{x^4 + z^4 + 6}.\]By AM-GM,
\[x^4 + 1 + 1 + 1 \ge 4 \sqrt[4]{x^4} = 4x,\]and
\[z^4 + 1 + 1 + 1 \ge 4 \sqrt[4]{z^4} = 4z.\]Then $x^4 + z^4 + 6 \ge 4(x + z),$ which implies
\[\frac{x + z}{x^4 + z^4 + 6} \le \frac{1}{4}.\]Equality occurs when $x = z = 1,$ so the maximum value is $\boxed{\frac{1}{4}}.$
